page.title: 19LEISURE SURVEY
page.content: THE AVERAGE AGE OF PEOPLE WHO PARTICIPATED IN THIS PARTICULAR SURVEY WAS 26 OF WHICH 20% WERE UNEMPLOYED, 14% WERE HOUSEWIVES AND 66% WERE IN FULL-TIME EMPLOYMENT. THE AVERAGE PERIOD IN WHICH THEY HAD LIVED IN THE AREA IS APPROXIMATELY 4 YEARS SO THEY KNOW THE AREA RELATIVELY WELL. THE MAJORITY OF THOSE SURVEYED SAID THEY HAD ENOUGH TIME TO PARTICIPATE IN VARIOUS LEISURE ACTIVITIES, ROUGHLY BETWEEN 2-3 HOURS EACH EVENING. 70% SAID THEIR FAVOURITE LEISURE ACTIVITY WAS INACTIVE WHILST 30% SAID THAT THEIRS WAS ACTIVE. OF THIS TOTAL 90% OF THEM SAID THAT THEY HAD TO TRAVEL INTO TOWN OR FURTHER TO PARTICIPATE IN THE ACTIVITY.
